p: In the realm of mathematical epidemiology discussed in Section 4.1 above, Daniel Bernoulli [ 165] pioneered the application of mathematical tools in epidemiology in 1766. This was further enriched by the extensive research of Robert May, among others, in the 20th century [ 166, 167]. To this day, the analysis of field data using variants of the SIR differential equations (Equations 1a-1c) given in Section 5.1 gives us the ability to predict the trajectory of an infection process in a compact manner [ 167]. In recent years, several Zika-specific extensions of the SIR model have been explored for the prediction of ZIKV infection [ 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36].
